ArrayBinarySearchTree

public ArrayBinarySearchTree(T element)

Parameters:
element - the element that will become the root of the new tree
Method Detail

addElement

public void addElement(T element)
Adds the specified object to this binary search tree in the appropriate position according to its key value. Note that equal elements are added to the right. Also note that the index of the left child of the current index can be found by doubling the current index and adding 1. Finding the index of the right child can be calculated by doubling the current index and adding 2.

Specified by:
addElement in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Parameters:
element - the element to be added to the search tree

removeElement

public T removeElement(T targetElement)
                throws jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException
Removes the first element that matches the specified target element from this binary search tree and returns a reference to it. Throws an ElementNotFoundException if the specified target element is not found in the binary search tree.

Specified by:
removeElement in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Parameters:
targetElement - the element to be removed from the tree
Returns:
a reference to the removed element
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException - if an element not found exception occurs

removeMin

public T removeMin()
            throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Removes the node with the least value from this binary search tree and returns a reference to its element. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if the binary search tree is empty.

findMin

public T findMin()
          throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Returns the element with the least value in this binary search tree. It does not remove the node from the binary search tree. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if the binary search tree is empty.

Specified by:
findMin in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Returns:
the element with the least value in this binary search tree
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if an empty collection exception occurs

findMax

          throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Returns the element with the highest value in this binary search tree. It does not remove the node from the binary search tree. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if the binary search tree is empty.

findIndex

protected int findIndex(java.lang.Comparable<T> targetElement,
                        int n)
                 throws jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException
Returns the index of the specified target element if it is found in this binary tree. Throws an ElementNotFoundException if the specified target element is not found in the binary tree.

Parameters:
targetElement - the element being sought in the tree
Returns:
true if the element is in the tree
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException - if an element not found exception occurs
